proficiencies: Acrobatics +11, Arcana +17, Deception +19, History +17, Intimidation +19, Investigation +11, Perception +10, Persuasion +13, Sleight of Hand +11, Stealth +11
condition_immunities: charmed, diseased, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, sleep
traits:
Heart of the Storm. Whenever The Mistwalker casts a spell of 1st level or higher that deals lightning or thunder damage, creatures of her choice within 10 feet of her take 10 points of lightning or thunder damage.

Immutable Form. The Mistwalker is immune to any spell or effect that would alter her form.

Legendary Resistance (5/Day). If The Mistwalker fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed.

Plant Avatar. The Mistwalker is considered a plant for the purposes of special spell effects targeting plants. When she dies, her form crumbles into random chunks of bark.

Superior Undead Resilience (1/Day). If The Mistwalker is reduced to 0 hit points by any damage other than psychic, she regains 100 hit points.
actions:
Multiattack. The Mistwalker makes four Rotting Cutlass attacks.

Rotting Cutlass. Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d6+7) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

Spells. The Mistwalker casts two cantrips followed by two spells, one of which must be at 2nd-level or lower.
bonus_actions:
Lightning Tines. The Mistwalker casts witch bolt, requiring no concentration or material components, and damages any targets already under the effects of witch bolt. The damage of the spell is a number of d12s equivalent to the number of targets affected by witch bolt.

Tempestuous Magic. Immediately before or after casting a spell of 1st level or higher, The Mistwalker can fly up to 10 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.
legendary_actions:
The Mistwalker can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Mistwalker regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Rotting Cutlass. The Mistwalker makes a Rotting Cutlass attack.
Lightning Tines. The Mistwalker uses the Lightning Tines action.
Misty Step. The Mistwalker casts misty step.
reactions:
Obfuscation. If The Mistwalker succeeds a saving throw against magic that would teleport her against her will, she can become invisible. She is also able to manipulate the spellcaster's perception of their spell to make them believe it succeeded, even allowing them to maintain concentration.

Storm's Fury. When The Mistwalker is hit by a melee attack, she can deal 20 points of lightning damage to the attacker. The attacker must also succeed on a DC 21 STR save or be pushed in a straight line up to 20 feet from her.

actions: Club. Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

proficiencies: Persuasion +17, Intimidation +17, Deception +17, Athletics +10, Perception +8, Survival +14, Investigation +9, Insight +8
traits:
Elusive. No attack roll can have advantage against Admiral Jaguar while he isn't incapacitated.

Evasion. When Admiral Jaguar is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, he takes no damage on a success and only half damage if he fails.

Fancy Footwork. If Admiral Jaguar makes a melee attack against a creature, that creature can't make opportunity attacks against him for the rest of his turn.

Legendary Resistance (3/Day). If Admiral Jaguar fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

Master Duelist (1/Long or Short Rest). If Admiral Jaguar misses with an attack roll, he can roll it again with advantage.

Rakish Audacity. Admiral Jaguar can add his Charisma modifier to his initiative rolls.

Reliable Talent. When Admiral Jaguar makes an ability check that uses his proficiency bonus, he can treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

Stroke of Luck (1/Long or Short Rest). If Admiral Jaguar misses a target within range, he can turn the miss into a hit. Alternatively, if he fails an ability check, he can treat the d20 roll as a 20.
actions:
Multiattack. Admiral Jaguar makes one Captain's Edict (Sneak Attack) attack, and one Captain's Edict attack.

Captain's Edict (Sneak Attack). Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 46 (11d6+8) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

Captain's Edict. Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d6+8) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

Palm Pistol. Ranged Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, range 20/80 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8+5) piercing damage. misfire 1, powder, carrying 6
bonus_actions:
Palm Pistol. Admiral Jaguar makes a Palm Pistol attack.

Cunning Action. Admiral Jaguar takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

Elegant Maneuver. Admiral Jaguar gains advantage on the next Acrobatics or Athletics check he makes on this turn.

Captain's Edict: Compelled Duel. Admiral Jaguar casts compelled duel from Captain's Edict.
legendary_actions:
Admiral Jaguar can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Admiral Jaguar regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

Captain's Edict. Admiral Jaguar makes a Captain's Edict attack.
Palm Pistol. Admiral Jaguar makes a Palm Pistol attack.
reactions:
Parry. Admiral Jaguar adds 6 to his AC against one melee attack that would hit him. To do so, he must see the attacker and be holding a melee weapon.

Uncanny Dodge. Admiral Jaguar halves the damage of an attack that hits him. To do so, he must see the attacker.

resistances: fire, radiant, non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing
traits:
Flyby. Eden doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when she flies out of an enemy's reach.

Innate Spellcasting. Eden's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). Eden can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

3/day each: compelled duel, guiding bolt (as a 5th-level spell)

1/day each: daylight, fireball (as a 6th-level spell)

Magic Resistance. Eden has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Relentless (1/Long or Short Rest). If Eden takes 21 damage or less that would reduce her to 0 hit points, she is reduced to 1 hit point instead.
actions:
Multiattack. Eden makes two Longsword attacks, and one Warhammer attack.

Longsword. Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8+6) fire damage, or 11 (1d10+6) fire damage if used with two hands plus 18 (4d8) fire damage.

Warhammer. Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8+6) bludgeoning damage, or 11 (1d10+6) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands plus 18 (4d8) radiant damage.
legendary_actions:
Admiral Jaguar can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Admiral Jaguar regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

Captain's Edict. Admiral Jaguar makes a Captain's Edict attack.
Palm Pistol. Admiral Jaguar makes a Palm Pistol attack.
reactions: Parry. Eden adds +5 to her AC against one melee attack that would hit her. To do so, she must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

traits:
Legionnaire's Discipline. The shieldbearer has advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed when within 10 feet of an ally who isn't incapacitated.

Legionnaire's Tactics. The shieldbearer has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the shieldbearer's allies is in melee range with the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

Shield Warrior. The shieldbearer can wield its pike one handed if it has a shield in its other hand. If the shieldbearer's tower shield is deployed, it can only make attacks in the direction the shield is facing.

Tower Shield. When closed, the shieldbearer's shield behaves like a normal shield. When deployed, the shield loses it AC bonus, lowers the shieldbearer's speed by 10 ft., and provides full cover in a single direction. The direction of this cover is determined by the shieldbearer as a free action. The tower shield can be targeted. It has AC 23 and 50 hit points.
actions:
Multiattack. Shieldbearer makes two Pike attacks or makes two Talons attacks.

Pike. Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10+4) piercing damage.

Talons. Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4+4) slashing damage.
bonus_actions: Deploy Shield. The shieldbearer deploys or closes its tower shield.

resistances: non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing, poison
traits:
Immutable Form. The Everscream is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

Legendary Resistance (5/Day). If the Everscream fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Rooted. The Everscream cannot unwillingly become prone if it still has its roots.

Siege Monster. The Everscream deals double damage to objects and structures.
actions:
Multiattack. Everscream uses the Deck the Halls action one time followed by one Sweep the Floor attack, and one Pine Needles attack.

Sweep the Floor. Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., five targets. Hit: 18 (2d10+7) bludgeoning damage.

Pine Needles. Ranged Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, range 40/120 ft., five targets. Hit: 12 (1d10+7) piercing damage.

Deck the Halls (Recharge 5-6). The Everscream launches ornaments at up to 10 different targets within 30 feet. Each target must make a DC 17 DEX save, taking 3d6 bludgeoning damage and 2d8 piercing damage on a fail, or half on a success. Creatures within five feet of each target must make a DC 15 CON save, taking 2d8 piercing damage on a fail, or none on a success. A creature can take damage from at most three ornaments on one turn, even if they are forced to save against more.
bonus_actions:
Summon Snowman. The Everscream summons two Snowmen out of a pile of snow within 30 feet. If the Everscream is killed, all summoned snowmen die with it.

"Dash". The Everscream moves up to its movement speed.

condition_immunities: charmed, deafened, diseased, frightened, poisoned, sleep
traits: Made of Snow. If the temperature is above 0 degrees Celsius, the Snowman takes 1 point of damage per hour per degree above 0. If the Snowman is killed by any means, it collapses into a nonmagical pile of snow.
actions: Snow Club. Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d4+7) cold damage.
bonus_actions: Snowball. Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d4+7) cold damage.

proficiencies: Athletics +10, Acrobatics +9, Perception +7, Persuasion +11, Performance +15, Survival +3, Sleight of Hand +13
traits:
Fancy Footwork. If Sea Hawk makes a melee attack against a creature on his turn, it can't make opportunity attacks against him for the rest of his turn.

Pyrotechnic Propensity. If Sea Hawk rolls dice to determine fire damage, the number of dice rolled is doubled, and the lowest any die can roll is a two.
actions:
Multiattack. Sea Hawk makes two Radiant Rapier attacks.

Radiant Rapier. Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8+6) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) radiant damage, and 14 (4d6) piercing damage if the attack has advantage, or no other creature but the target is within 5 feet.

Confusing Conversation (1/Long Rest). Sea Hawk subjects a creature that can hear and understand him to a charming yet confusing monologue. The target creature is stunned until the start of Sea Hawk's next turn.
bonus_actions:
Adventurous Accuracy (3/Long Rest). Sea Hawk gains advantage on weapon attack rolls until the end of his turn, and gains 10 temporary hit points.

Instant Ignition. Sea Hawk ignites a flammable object within his reach.
reactions: Surprising Survivability. When Sea Hawk takes damage he can use his reaction to take half of it, unless he has already made a saving throw to reduce the amount of damage taken.
